revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of the Phoca: The Sea-Calf
tldr: The author provides a detailed description of the Phoca, or sea-calf, based on their observation of a specimen. They describe its physical features, such as its webbed feet and the structure of its whiskers, as well as its internal anatomy, including its organs and reproductive system. The author also discusses the animal's diet and behavior, and compares their findings to those of other natural historians.
